title: Netanyahu Holds Talks With Rival Over Forming Coalition Government
text:
TEL AVIV—Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his rival, Benny Gantz, began talks Monday night to form a coalition government, under pressure from Israel’s president after no clear winner emerged from last week’s election.

The rivals emerged from a nearly two-hour meeting at President Reuven Rivlin’s residence without an agreement. But Mr. Rivlin described it as “a significant step forward,” with Messrs. Gantz and Netanyahu speaking directly about the next step. Mr. Rivlin left the room after about an hour, leaving...
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his rival, Benny Gantz, began talks to form a coalition government, under pressure from Israel’s president after no clear winner emerged from last week’s election.
